newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: GROLSCH SEES 1996 FULL YR PROFIT RISING.
newsitem.headline: GROLSCH SEES 1996 FULL YR PROFIT RISING.

text.p: Dutch brewer Grolsch NV said on Wednesday its full-year 1996 profits would be higher than in 1995.
"On balance we expect another profit rise for the full year in line with our earlier forecasts," it said in a statement.
The company said in March it expected a further profit rise in 1996, after posting a 12 percent profit increase to 58.8 million guilders in 1995.

Grolsch said moderate weather conditions in northern Europe compared with July and August last year meant the Dutch beer market, amongst others, would contract in the second half year versus the same 1995 period.
It added group sales costs and interest charges would increase, but said all this would be off-set by growing market share in the Netherlands in the second half of the year.
"We also expect an ongoing rise in export volume (from Dutch breweries) and an increase in the sales of our foreign associates," Grolsch said in a statement.
The group earlier announced an 11 percent rise in first half net to 21 million guilders, in line with expectations.
